subject: Horse Racing
Women
lead_paragraph: Emma-Jayne Wilson became the first female jockey to win the Queen’s Plate, the first leg of the Canadian triple crown, when she rode the 15-1 long shot Mike Fox to victory yesterday at Woodbine Racetrack. Wilson made her move after the turn to win by half a length.In 2005, Wilson won 175 races and earned more than $6.9 million in purses en route to being named North America’s top apprentice rider. The following year she led all Woodbine riders with 144 victories and finished second in earnings with more than $6.5 million to again be named Canada’s top apprentice.
